place.note: Empire in Central Europe, 1867–1918.
Now called Panteleimona Kulisha St
Capital of Moldova, part of the Russian kingdom from 1812 to 1917.
Another name for Gomel is Homyel.
Historical Region, today located in Moldova and Ukraine.
Called Silent Ocean in the Source.
Named Ceylon in the Source.
Was an exclave of Hungary. Now in Croatia, called Rijeka.
Named Kasimirgasse 35 in 1904.
Congress Poland, Congress Kingdom of Poland, or Russian Poland, formally known as the Kingdom of Poland.
The historical region Macedonia is not the same as present day Republic of Macedonia.
Now called Lüshun Port. Part of Imperial Russia until 1904, Imperial Japan 1905-1945, the Soviet Union 1945-1956, and China since 1956.
Was also known as Jemulpo. Since 1910 it is called Incheon (Metropolitan City).
Prussia Province existed from 1824 to 1878. Before and after it was divided into East and West Prussia.
Thessaloniki, now a part of Greece in the province of Macedonia, was not part of Greece in 1904.
Was called Mukden from the 17th century until 1914.
Was called Rzeznicka from 1871-1941
Was called Sykstuska from 1871 till 1938.
Historical region. Was part of Sweden, later Russia.
Part of Russia until 1917.
Historical region in today's Latvia and Estonia.
River between Russia and Estonia.
Penal colony in the Pacific Ocean. Located in the French colonies.
Former German colony, included present-day Burundi, Rwanda, the Tanzania mainland, and the Kionga Triangle.
